resources.string: Select in this tab the numbers that should be able to control and get informations about your phone by SMS.
This phone number has already been added
This contact does not have any phone number
Sends the GPS or network location of the phone (GPS must be enabled).

List of available commands. Tu execute a command, one have to send it to this phone through a SMS message from an authorized number.\nFor example, the message \"!locate\" will request the phone location, which will be sent back by SMS.
The app does not have the required permissions to execute this command.
This command has not been enabled in the application.
Enter the phone number to add
You have to grant the app access to edit system settings (enable GPS, mobile data...) for some feature to work correctly.
Sends information about the phone: battery level, last location...
Make the phone ring for 10 seconds. If an argument is provided, it will define the duration of the ringing. !ring 120 will make the phone ring for 2 minutes.
The application can\'t receive or send any SMS. It will then not be able to run commands sent by SMS
The app will restart to apply changes and setup the SMS receiver.
Anyone will be able to send commands on your phone. It is recommended to enable the password feature with this one.
Notification alerting that the phone is ringing due to a received !ring command
Extended non-use of Monitor Internetless may cause location or message reading permissions to be automatically deleted. You can disable this option in the app settings.
A password is required. Log yourself with !login [password]
Incorrect password!\nSend \"!login [Password]\" replacing [Password] by the password you defined in the app.
If you experience issues with command execution, try disabling battery optimization for this app.
Ask to send the password with !login when someone tries to send commands. All users are disconnected when starting the app.
You are authenticated: you can now send commands!
Send \"!login [Password]\" replacing [Password] by the password you defined in the app.
GPS is disabled: unable to fetch the current location.
Locating...\nIt might take up to a minute
Notification to inform of a tracking of the phone location due to a received !locate command
A command \"!locate\" is locating your device...
The phone rings ! Touch to stop the ring.
The phone rings for %1$d minutes and %2$d seconds!
Unable to make the phone ring
GPS location seems slow.\nHere is the network location:
GPS is disabled.\nHere is an approximate network location:

Since commands are sent via SMS, Monitor Internetless needs to be able to receive, read, and send SMS messages. This data is only used for app commands, and only messages containing a command keyword will be parsed by Monitor Internetless.
This command requires Monitor Internetless to access your location, even in the background. The location will only be requested when executing a location command, and will not be saved.
